data.text: Tent versus Bivy Bag: Your Choice?

Tent vs Bivy Bag - what's your go-to shelter? When I started bikepacking, I always used a tent, with a big porch and plenty of space. However, once I had tried out a bivy bag, I loved the freedom and small pack size it gives. Some trips and locations are better suited to certain types of shelters, but it's great to have options. I made a short video on the subject, let me what you think and which one you prefer! [https://youtu.be/4MoOSGALB64](https://youtu.be/4MoOSGALB64)

data.text: Bivies are great for tiny spaces, but I wouldn't really use one for more than a night or two unless in an arid climate. Kinda nice be able to air and dry the sleeping bag, which can be tough in the pacific NW where I live. Plus ultralight tents have come so far in recent years. Also, bug season is easier in a tent :)
